content: bilateral hand numbness and tingling as well as burning pain
title: Chief Complaint

content: The patient presents with bilateral hand numbness, tingling, and burning pain that began around July 1, 2025. She reports similar symptoms at the end of her previous pregnancy, but these are earlier in onset and more intense. She has been seeing her OB, who recommended injections and referred her to this office. She has been using splints without sufficient improvement to sleep through the night. Symptoms have persisted despite conservative management.
title: HPI Spencer

content: Got PCTS, uh, some decreased sensation to the middle fingers, noted.
title: Musculoskeletal

content: X-rays deferred secondary to pregnancy, it'll be planned carpal tunnel.
title: Imaging Results

content: Risks and temporary nature discussed with patient.
Return to clinic in three months for follow-up if symptoms persist postpartum.
title: Plan
